sections.title: Setup Atom
sections.subHeading: Atom is a cross platform, customisable text editor for coding.
sections.intro: You need a text editor to work in this unit. Atom is recommended. (Off campus students, if you have your own preferred text editor you may use that.)
tasks: Open your prep for unit  markup in this text editor

sections.title: Using Git
sections.subHeading: How do you keep track of code when working in teams?
sections.intro: Git is a powerful tool to keep track of and to share your code. It lets us maintain multiple versions and makes it really easy to share our code with the world.
sections.callToAction: Use the slides (follow the link) for how to start working with GIT and complete the following tasks:
tasks: Install a [git client](https://git-scm.com/downloads). If using windows be sure to include git bash.
Create a new repository, clone it to your computer and commit your code from the prep for unit
